newsitem.title: FRANCE: Canada seen getting 10 pct of Pakistan wheat deal.
newsitem.headline: Canada seen getting 10 pct of Pakistan wheat deal.

text.p: Canada is likely to be included with 50,000 tonnes of wheat in a key Pakistani grain purchase expected to be announced shortly, European grain traders said.
They said the Canadian Wheat Board had offered 50,000 tonnes of wheat at $147.50 per tonne fob in Pakistan's tender for a total volume of 500,000 tonnes to be shipped in August and September.
"I think it's pretty clear the Canadians are firm with their 50,000 tonnes," one trader said.
The rest of the purchase was expected to be roughly evenly split between U.S. and Australian wheat, depending on GSM government financing in the United States, traders said.
One trader predicted the breakdown would be around 200,000 to 250,000 tonnes of U.S. white wheat, 50,000 tonnes of Canadian wheat and the rest Australian.
Traders said a cumulative total of more than 500,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat had been offered in mostly 25,000-tonne lots priced between $148 per tonne and as high as $153 per tonne.
A stream of offers totalling around a million tonnes of Australian wheat had been priced in a tight range between $158 per tonne and just over $159 per tonne, traders said.
Pakistan seeks 500,000 tonnes of optional-origin wheat for August 11-September 10 shipment.
Tender results are expected to be announced shortly.
